text_version.content: In this Act, beard means any facial hair no shorter than 5 millimetres in length that:
occurs on or below the chin, or
exists in an uninterrupted line from the front of one ear to the front of the other ear below the nose.

text_version.content: The wearing of any beard whatsoever, except as provided in section 6, is prohibited within the Commonwealth of Australia.

enactment.heading: Wearing of a beard without exemption

text_version.content: Any person found to be wearing a beard within the Commonwealth of Australia without proper exemption as granted under section 6 commits an offence.

enactment.name: /test/acts/47/7

text_version.content: The office of the Department of Beards may, from time to time or as they see fit, grant exemptions to persons from the prohibition contained in section 5.
Any such exemption granted under subsection 1 is to be for no longer than a period of 12 months.

text_version.content: Where an exemption is granted under section 6, the Department of Beards shall issue to the person so exempted a token, hereinafter referred to as a beardcoin, that shall for all purposes be regarded as substantive proof of such exemption.
The beardcoin shall be a cryptocurrency token using a blockchain approved by the Department of Beards.

The beardcoin's blockchain shall be in substantially the following form. WHEREAS this beardcoin is approved by the Department of Beards under section 6,\n                     it is secured by the following blockchain: □□□□□□□□□□.

predicate.content: ${the_department_of_beards} granted an exemption from the prohibition of wearing beards

statement.name: the Department of Beards granted a beard exemption

text_version.content: It shall be an offence to buy, sell, lend, lease, gift, transfer or receive in any way a beardcoin from any person or body other than the Department of Beards, except as provided in Part 4.
It shall be no defense to a charge under section 7A that the purchase, sale, lease, gift, transfer or receipt was of counterfeit beardcoin rather than genuine beardcoin.
The Department of Beards may issue licenses to such
barbers,
hairdressers, or
other male grooming professionals
as they see fit to purchase a beardcoin from a customer
whose beard they have removed,
and to resell those beardcoins to the Department of Beards.
